p.s: I was wondering whether racism really is as big of a problem as it is portrayed in the media in germanyGermany.
I found this article that resembles the general picture that we have here in germanyGermany about racism in the USA.
The article was published online by Zeit online which is the online version of the newspaper of the popular germanGerman news agency Zeit.
The article beginnsbegins with the statement that racism is still an important topic in americaAmerica which can be seen on the victim of police brutality Michael Brown in Ferguson.
But the differences in the treatment are present everywhere.
Statistics say that black people are more likely to get arrested and additionally that the differences got even bigger in recent decades.
The police is controlling black people more often and thorough that they controllcontrol white people.

p.add: (The term stop-and-frisk is mentioned. Is this term a term that is used or is it something dead that only some people use?)

p.s: The Civil Rights Act that was signed 50 years ago (the article is a bit older) is also mentioned but the article says that this is mostly on paper and black people are socially and economically in a disadvantage compared to the white population which begins as early as the education.
It is said that black people graduate not only less often but also with lower degrees like High School or College degrees while white people get a bachelors degree more often.
It is also mentioned that black people are more often unemployed than white people.
In the end the article states that more than a quarter of the black population lives in poverty while in the white population it is less than 10 percent.
All in all the differences seem really big and I was wondering wheatherwether these diffrencesdifferences are as prominent as portrayed in this article.
I look forward to your answer
